objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The National Cyber Security Centre (UK) authored and published this malware analysis report and provided YARA and SIGMA detection rules.

objects.name: Devil Bait C2 domain
objects.description: Primary command-and-control domain used by Devil Bait for stage delivery and exfiltration.

objects.name: Second-stage VBScript download URL
objects.description: Hardcoded C2 URL used to download the second-stage VBScript via HTTP GET.

objects.name: Exfiltration URL
objects.description: Hardcoded C2 URL used to POST exfiltrated, base64-encoded system enumeration data (1.txt).

objects.name: Beaconing payload URL
objects.description: URL retrieved by scheduled task AhnlabUpdate using mshta.exe every 10 minutes.

objects.name: Embedded VBScript execution URL
objects.description: URL contacted by embedded VBScript to retrieve and execute code from the document body.

objects.name: Embedded VBScript domain
objects.description: Domain embedded in the malicious document used to fetch and execute additional code.

objects.name: First-stage VBScript file
objects.description: VBScript written by the malicious Word macro and executed via wscript.exe to fetch the second stage.

objects.name: System enumeration output file
objects.description: XML file where collected system information is written prior to exfiltration.

objects.name: Encoded system data file
objects.description: File containing base64-encoded system enumeration data (certificate-format) used for exfiltration.

objects.name: First-stage VBScript directory
objects.description: Directory used by the malware to store and execute the first-stage VBScript (version.xml).

objects.name: System data staging directory
objects.description: Directory used by the malware to stage system enumeration and encoded data prior to exfiltration.

objects.name: IE first run customization disabled
objects.description: Registry key modified by embedded VBScript to prevent IE first-run customization as part of evasion.

objects.name: IE default browser check disabled
objects.description: Registry key modified by embedded VBScript to prevent IE default-browser check as part of evasion.

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document used to deliver Devil Bait.

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document used to deliver Devil Bait.

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document used to deliver Devil Bait.

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious second-stage VBScript retrieved from C2.

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious second-stage VBScript retrieved from C2.

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious second-stage VBScript retrieved from C2.

objects.name: devil bait
objects.description: Devil Bait is a malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document that targets Korean speakers and downloads and runs a second-stage VBScript via HTTP. The first-stage VBA constructs and executes an XML file containing VBScript (version.xml) using wscript.exe, which retrieves the second-stage VBScript from a C2 server. The malware performs system enumeration using Windows binaries (systeminfo, ipconfig /all, tasklist, and directory listings), encodes the collected data using certutil.exe, and exfiltrates it over HTTP. Persistence is achieved through a scheduled task named AhnlabUpdate that uses mshta.exe to retrieve and execute remote content every 10 minutes. It masquerades as the legitimate AhnLab security product in its persistence mechanism and uses ServerXMLHTTP for C2 communications.

objects.name: AhnLab
objects.description: A legitimate South Korean security product that Devil Bait impersonates for persistence by creating a scheduled task named AhnlabUpdate.

objects.name: VirusTotal
objects.description: Referenced as the source where the second-stage VBScript was retrieved from available sandbox data and for retro-hunts/pivoting revealing variants.

objects.name: Microsoft
objects.description: Vendor of software components targeted or used by the malware, including Microsoft Word (macros), Office registry settings, and Internet Explorer automation.

objects.name: Kimsuky
objects.description: Kimsuky actors are referenced for previously using the technique of masquerading as AhnLab and employing 'Update' in autorun names (e.g., AhnlabUpdate). The report notes an association of this persistence style with the group.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
objects.description: Devil Bait uses the WScript shell from within other scripts to spawn cmd.exe instances to collect system information.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task
objects.description: Devil Bait creates a Scheduled Task to beacon every 10 minutes.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Devil Bait Command and Control is achieved over HTTP using the scripting object ServerXMLHTTP.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Devil Bait sends system enumeration data over HTTP to the C2 server.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: Devil Bait masquerades as AhnLab, a legitimate security product, in its persistence mechanism.

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in second stage VBScript used
by Devil Bait."

    strings:
       $ = "WScript.Shell" nocase
       $ = "Scripting.FileSystemObject" nocase
       $ = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0" nocase
       $ = "FolderExists" nocase
       $ = "certutil" nocase
       $ = "vbCrLf" nocase
       $ = "expandenvironmentstrings" nocase
       $ = "%appdata%" nocase
    condition:

    filesize < 20KB and all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_Maldoc
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_Maldoc {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in the Devil Bait malicious
document."

    strings:

   $word = "MSWordDoc"
   $ms_xml = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0"
   $ = {53 65 6E 64 3A 45 78 65 63 75 74 65 28 [1-6] 2E 72 65 73 70

6F 6E 73 65 54 65 78 74 29}// Send:Execute(<variable>.responseText)

   $ = "wscript.exe //e:vbscript"

    condition:

    all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_C2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_C2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "C2 and IoC strings found in Devil Bait second
stage vbscript."

    strings:
       $file_1 = "sr011.xml"

       $must_func = "Roller"
       $must_C2 = ".co.kr"

       $c2_1 = "cross.php"
       $c2_2 = "report.php"
       $c2_3 = "list.php"
       $c2_4 = "show.php"
    condition:
        $file_1 and any of ($must_*) and any of ($c2_*)
}

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_1
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_1 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies the first stage vbscript
written to disk e.g. version.xml."

    strings:
        $must_1 = "On Error Resume Next:Set"
        $must_2 = "CreateObject(\"MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0\"):"
        $must_3 = ".Send:Execute("
        $must_4 = "http"
        $get = "GET"
        $post = "POST"
    condition:

    filesize < 10KB and all of ($must*) and ($get or $post)

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Devil Bait
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. devil bait.
